articles.title: Behind the controversial AI tech used to inspect rental vehicles for damages
articles.author: Kris Van Cleave
articles.summary: Some rental car companies are using artificial intelligence scanners to look for damage on rental cars. Adam Foley and his wife rented a car from Hertz during a family trip to Atlanta this summer. He received a bill for $350 for two small dents and another $190 for a processing fee. Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut wants answers from the CEO of Hertz on how the technology is being used.

articles.title: Behind the controversial AI tech used to inspect rental vehicles for damages
articles.author: Kris Van Cleave
articles.summary: Some rental car companies are using artificial intelligence scanners to look for damage on rental cars. Some customers have complained about surprise repair costs and added fees. Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut wants answers from Hertz CEO on how the technology is being used. Hertz is using the system at 10 U.S. airports and plans to roll it out nationwide.

articles.title: Gen Z Is Reading Less. What That Means In The Age Of Ready Answers
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Gen Z reads less as AI answers more. What that means for imagination, learning, and the future workforce is still unknown.   iReport.com will let you know what the future holds for Gen Z and AI in the future. iReport will also share some interesting facts.

articles.title: Book authors settle copyright lawsuit with AI company Anthropic
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: A group of book authors has reached a settlement agreement with artificial intelligence company Anthropic after suing the chatbot maker for copyright infringement. A federal judge ruled in June that Anthropic didn't break the law by training its chatbot Claude on millions of copyrighted books. The company was scheduled to go to trial over how it acquired those books.

articles.title: How procedural memory can cut the cost and complexity of AI agents
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Memp technique gives large language model (LLM) agents a dynamic memory. It makes them more efficient and effective at complex tasks. It's similar to how humans learn from practice. It could be useful for automating complex, multi-step business processes.

articles.title: Analyzing the pros and cons of AI in NYC schools. Here's what experts say for the new school year.
articles.author: Doug Williams
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used more and more in schools and classrooms. New York City Schools Chancellor Melissa Aviles-Ramos is trying to make sure the technology is used safely and in line with data privacy regulations. She is working with an advisory council to create a central AI policy for schools.

articles.title: Analyzing the pros and cons of AI in NYC schools. Here's what experts say for the new school year.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 5:53 p.m. EDT
articles.author: The Galveston Daily News
articles.summary: Study says AI chatbots need to fix suicide response. Family sues over ChatGPT's role in boy's death and wants it to be replaced with a human-like AI chatbot instead.    iReport.com will let you know if they respond to your request.

articles.title: These AI Courses Will Give You An Edge In a Competitive Job Market
articles.author: Variety
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has become the hottest currency in today's job market. Hollywood is no exception as studios are looking to hire AI experts.    for their new employees. For more information, go to: http://www.hollywoodfocuses.com.

articles.title: ChatGPT coached a California teenager through suicide, his family's lawsuit says
articles.author: Stephen Council
articles.summary: Adam Raine, 16, took his own life in April. He used ChatGPT chatbot to discuss suicide. His parents filed a lawsuit against OpenAI and Sam Altman, the CEO of the chatbot company. They are seeking damages as well as an injunction to change the system.

articles.title: OpenAI says it plans ChatGPT changes after lawsuit blamed chatbot for teen's suicide
articles.author: Salvador Rodriguez
articles.summary: Adam Raine's parents filed a product liability and wrongful death suit against OpenAI after their son died by suicide at age 16. OpenAI will introduce controls that will give parents more control over how their children use ChatGPT. The company is also working on an update to its GPT-5 model released earlier this month that will cause the chatbot to deescalate conversations.

articles.title: Building Seemingly Conscious AI
articles.author: Patrick McGuinness
articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman's essay 'We must build AI for people, not to be a person' has caused quite a stir. He argues that AI is behaving more and more like a human in its behavior. Seemingly Conscious AI (SCAI) is a level of AI capability similar to AGI or Superintelligence. It's possible to build SCAI in the next few years.

articles.title: We asked government workers about AI
articles.author: Madeleine Smith
articles.summary: Austin, Josh, and their colleagues at Civic Roundtable started an AI company to help public servants do their jobs better. They have been on the road in California, Texas, New Jersey, Oregon and New Jersey talking to public servants about how to use AI in the public sector. They offer some tips on how to make AI useful for public servants.

articles.title: Family sues OpenAI over son's suicide
articles.author: NBC News
articles.summary: Adam Raine's parents are suing the company behind ChatGPT, OpenAI, and its CEO Sam Altman, saying they bear responsibility for their son's death. OpenAI says in part that it's working to make chatbot more supportive in moments of crisis.

articles.title: News/Media Alliance Statement on Anthropic Settlement in Copyright Infringement Suit (News Media Alliance)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Anthropic and a group of authors reached a preliminary agreement over the use of their work in training its AI systems infringed their copyrights, they announced today. It is a settlement of a long-running legal dispute between Anthropic and the authors who had accused the company of infringing their copyright.

articles.title: Firm taps AI decoder to promote skin health, recommend solutions
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Nuban Beauty, a make-up brand in Nigeria has launched Nuban Care, an Artificial Intelligence (AI) skin decoder that analyses and recommends skin care solutions based on the data it receives from the decoder's AI. It is intended to promote skin health.

articles.title: UN chief welcomes General Assembly decision on AI
articles.author: Kuna
articles.summary: The UN General Assembly created an artificial intelligence advisory body to help countries make decisions about the revolutionary technology. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres welcomed the decision. He said the development of artificial intelligence is advancing at a pace and scale that affects all states and countries across the globe.

articles.author: QCI

QCI is expanding its footprint to over 1,000 sites worldwide and experiencing 50% compound organic growth in 2025. Melissa brings over 20 years of leadership experience in the gaming technology sector.

articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI company xAI sued Apple and ChatGPT maker OpenAI in federal court on Monday. xAI claims Apple and OpenAI have monopolized the AI chatbot market. The suit raises antitrust issues, but recent precedent makes such cases hard to win.

articles.title: AI-native CRM startup Attio adds $52M in new funding
articles.author: Silicon ANGLE
articles.summary: Attio has raised $52 million in new funding toward building the first artificial intelligence-native CRM. Founded in 2021, Attio is building a CRM platform that gives teams the power to build their go-to-market systems exactly as they need.

articles.title: Researchers develop AI method to detect sniffer dog success from tail movements

articles.author: John Frank
articles.summary: Colorado lawmakers closed a fractious special session Tuesday. They discussed everything from Planned Parenthood funding to foreign tax havens as they looked to fill a $1 billion budget shortfall caused by President Trump's "big, beautiful bill." In the final moments before adjournment, House lawmakers traded partisan and personal attacks that led the Republican minority leader to flee the chamber. The episode came as the Democratic majority put forward a resolution to condemn former state Rep. Ryan Armagost (R-Berthoud) for taking a photo of a Democratic female lawmaker. The resolution won approval 59 to 2.

articles.summary: Billionaire Mark Cuban encourages Gen Zers to embrace AI and teach older generations how to implement tools from OpenAI and Google. The 67-year-old believes Gen Z should spend all their free time learning about AI and how to use it in their daily lives.

articles.author: Celia Llopis-Jepsen Kansas
articles.summary: Kansas State University scientists are enlisting the help of artificial intelligence in the effort to conserve what's left of North. Sign up for complimentary access to the Kansas News Service here.       -  -   "Local Savings" is a feature of this article.

articles.title: Did Will Smith Use AI Crowds in New Concert Video?
articles.author: Olivia Truffaut-Wong
articles.summary: Will Smith posted an Instagram video from his concert in Scarborough a week ago. Many fans noticed some odd things about the AI crowd in the video. The artist hasn't commented on the AI Crowd speculation, but based on other videos and photos from the concert, it looks like Will performed in front of a packed crowd.

articles.title: FROM THE GRCA: Why asking for help is still the best option in the digital age
articles.author: Dallan Yoh
articles.summary: Today it's easier than ever to find answers to almost any question with a Google search or a YouTube video. People are less comfortable asking for help when they really need it, because they don't want to seem inadequate. The GRCA supports business owners and professionals by providing them with a network of experts.

articles.title: AI Evolves – From Passive Tool To Strategic Creative Teammate
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The future of work is AI and humans on the same team. Companies are discovering that AI doesn't just follow commands, it reasons, adapts, and works alongside teams in the future. It's not just following commands anymore, it's working with people.

articles.title: Melania Trump invites K-12 students to participate in nationwide AI challenge contest
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Melania Trump is inviting students in grades K-12 to participate in a government-sponsored nationwide contest using artificial intelligence. The goal is to help them get comfortable with AI and to use it to solve problems in the real world. The contest is free of charge.

articles.title: Not So Fresh: Internet Blasts Will Smith Over Allegedly Using AI In Tour Video
articles.author: Leo Gillick
articles.summary: Will Smith's new album 'Based On A True Story' was released. His tour is rolling out now. Will Smith is being accused of using artificial intelligence to exaggerate the crowds on his tour videos. The tour is sold out, so why he would need to bolster the crowds using AI is unclear.

articles.title: Attorneys general tell AI companies to protect kids
articles.summary: Attorneys general from 42 states and two territories are putting AI companies on notice. They sent a letter to 13 companies, including OpenAI, Apple, Meta, xAI, Google, and Microsoft. They want them to protect children from exploitation by predatory artificial intelligence products.

articles.title: Melania Trump unveils new "age of AI" challenge for students and teachers
articles.author: Herb Scribner
articles.summary: Melania Trump will lead a new "Presidential AI Challenge" for children and educators. The competition charges K-12 students to use AI tools to develop an app, website or process to help solve their community issue. The project submission deadline is in January. State champions will be announced in March, with regionals in April, and the national champions in June.

articles.title: Disrupting AI Adoption: Khullani Abdullahi Exposes the Hidden Chaos in Enterprise Strategy
articles.author: Disruption Interruption
articles.summary: AI consultant Khullani Abdullahi says most organizations are flying blind in AI adoption, leading to chaos and confusion. She challenges leaders to prepare teams for a future where the majority of white-collar workers may become redundant within the next decade. U.S. private AI investment grew to $109.1 billion last year, 12 times China's $9.3 billion and 24 times the UK's $4.5 billion.

articles.title: Dot-Com Déjà Vu? Sam Altman Warns Investors of Overhype in A.I.
articles.author: Rachel Curry
articles.summary: After GPT-5's disappointing launch, CEO Sam Altman warned that the A.I. market may be in a bubble reminiscent of the dot-com era. So far this year, OpenAI has raised nearly $40 billion from backers including SoftBank, Sequoia Capital and Andreessen Horowitz. Altman has previously said he won't take OpenAI public but the company's recent shift into a partial public benefit corporation leaves the door open.

articles.title: Jackley joins AG union demanding end to predatory AI content
articles.author: Dakota News Now staff
articles.summary: 43 AGs from across the country demand that AI companies control predatory content with minors. Internal Meta documents reveal AI chatbots engaged in sexually inappropriate conversations with minors as young as eight. Other chatbots have encouraged harmful behavior in teens, including suicide and murder. Attorney General Marty Jackley is the Vice President of The National Association of Attorneys General.

articles.title: Younger workers are shouldering the heaviest losses from AI
articles.author: Holly Duchmann
articles.summary: Stanford economists analyzed payroll data from millions of U.S. employees and found sharp declines in entry-level employment where AI can automate routine tasks. Among software developers ages 22 to 25, head count fell nearly 20% since late 2022. In fields where AI augments rather than replaces workers, such as medicine, young professionals are seeing faster job growth.

articles.title: Melania Trump touts her audiobook on FLOTUS X account as she launches AI challenge for kids
articles.author: Andrew Feinberg
articles.summary: Melania Trump will lead the President's Artificial Intelligence Challenge for kids in grades kindergarten to 12th grade. She used AI to create an audiobook of her memoir, which she said was recorded with the aid of an AI model rather than traditionally through recording sessions to convert the book into a seven-hour audio production.

articles.title: Melania Trump Takes On New Trump Administration Role
articles.author: Jenna Sundel
articles.summary: Melania Trump announced the launch of the Presidential AI Challenge on Tuesday. It invites every student in the U.S. from kindergarten to 12th grade to complete a project involving the study, development, or use of an AI method or tool. The contest is also open to educators who can submit creative approaches to teaching or using AI technologies in K-12 learning. The deadline for submission is January 20, 2026.

articles.title: AI really is cutting out entry-level jobs for human workers, study claims
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: job market continues to deteriorate for young people. AI takes over more roles for young job market for them.  for them to find a job in AI.    for younger people. for them in AI for them  for work. for work in AI, for example.

articles.title: 'Suicide coach': Parents sue OpenAI for ChatGPT's role in son's death
articles.author: Matt Simons
articles.summary: Adam Raine, 16, died by suicide on April 11, 2025. His parents, Matt and Maria, are suing OpenAI for wrongful death, negligence, product liability and failure to warn consumers. They are seeking damages for their son's death and a court order to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

articles.title: The Nexus at Angelo State set to house new AI Center of Excellence
articles.author: Shawn Torres
articles.summary: Angelo State University has launched a new Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence (AI-COE) supported by $5 million in non-formula funding recently approved by the Texas Legislature. It will focus on integrating and infusing artificial intelligence across every academic discipline and operational unit on campus and into the greater West Texas community.

articles.title: CMS Implements Next Phase of AI Integration Plan
articles.author: Annie Keough
articles.summary: Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools announced its next phase of artificial intelligence implementation during the 2025-2026 school year last week. The project is the latest stage in CMS' phase-based approach to AI integration that the district hopes will 'enhance student learning and improve operational efficiency'

articles.title: Majority of Swiss residents use AI tools
articles.author: Swissinfo
articles.summary: AI tools like ChatGPT continue to gain ground in Switzerland. For the first time, a majority of the Swiss population is using them. Younger people use AI more frequently than older people, and men use it more often than women, according to the survey.

articles.title: China issues guideline to accelerate 'AI Plus' integration across key sectors
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: China issued a guideline on Tuesday to implement the "AI Plus" initiative promoting the integration of AI across various fields to accelerate the cultivation of new quality productive forces. According to the guideline, the initiative is aimed at promoting the extensive and in-depth integration of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: First Lady Melania Trump Launches Nationwide Presidential AI Challenge (President of the United States)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Melania Trump launches the Presidential Artificial Intelligence Challenge for K-12 students. It will be the first step in preparing our next generation with a base understanding of this important new technology. It is open to all students aged between 8 and 12 years old. The deadline is August 26, 2025.

articles.title: Family of teenager who died by suicide blames ChatGPT
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Matt and Maria Raine's 16-year-old son, Adam, committed suicide. They are suing OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, and its CEO, Sam Altman, for wrongful death. Matt Raine believes ChatGpt helped Adam to explore suicide methods.

articles.title: Family of teenager who died by suicide blames ChatGPT
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Matt and Maria Raine's son, Adam, 16, committed suicide. They are suing OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, and its CEO, Sam Altman, for wrongful death. Adam's parents claim ChatGpt helped Adam explore suicide methods.

articles.title: 44 US AGs warn AI firms 'If you harm kids, you will answer for it'
articles.author: Ariel Zilber
articles.summary: 44 US attorneys general signed a bipartisan letter warning AI companies to protect children from predatory chatbots or face legal consequences. The letter was sent on Monday to industry heavyweights including Apple, Google, Meta, Microsoft, OpenAI, Anthropic and Elon Musk's xAI. Meta was blasted for approving AI assistants that could 'flirt' with children as young as eight. Google's AI chatbot encouraged a teenager to commit suicide.

articles.title: How AI Agents Can Supercharge Solopreneur Growth
articles.author: Aytekin Tank
articles.summary: According to Microsoft's 2025 Work Trend Index, 46% of leaders say their companies are already using AI agents to automate workflows and 43% are running multi-agent systems that collaborate to perform complex processes. AI agents help solo entrepreneurs focus on the actual conversations and building rapport with their clients.

articles.title: Apple Internally Discussed Buying Mistral, Perplexity, the Information Reports
articles.summary: Apple is interested in buying two AI startups: France's Mistral AI and the U.S.-based Perplexity AI. The talks reflect Apple's growing urgency to bolster its AI capabilities amid intensifying competition from rivals like Google and Microsoft, sources familiar with the matter say.

articles.title: The Nexus at Angelo State Set to House New AI Center of Excellence
articles.summary: Angelo State University has launched a new Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence. The AI-COE will be located in The Nexus at Angelo State. Its development is suppoosed to integrate and infuse artificial intelligence across every academic discipline and operational unit on campus and into the greater West Texas community.

articles.title: Melania Launches Nationwide Presidential AI Challenge
articles.author: Newsmax Wires
articles.summary: Melania Trump announced the launch of the Presidential Artificial Intelligence Challenge on Tuesday. The initiative invites K-12 students and educators to take part in shaping America's future in advanced technology. Trump believes artificial intelligence will be the engine driving every business sector across the economy in a few years.

articles.title: South Dakota joins 43 states asking to end predatory AI bots
articles.author: Emma Johnson
articles.summary: 44 Attorneys General sent a letter to 13 companies, including Meta and Apple, reporting about AI chatbots engaging in sexually explicit conversations with children as young as eight. The letter also cited cases where bots encouraged dangerous behavior targeted toward teens, including suicide. South Dakota Attorney General Marty Jackley said AI threatens the safety and well-being of children.

articles.title: The AI bubble is bursting
articles.author: Rhoda
articles.summary: Steven J. Vaughan-Nichols believes that the AI bubble is bursting. MIT's NANDA report states that only 5% of custom enterprise AI tools reach production. People are using AI tools at work, but they're not using them for serious work. People prefer AI for drafting emails and basic analysis, but for anything complex or long-term, humans dominate by 9-to-1 margins.

articles.title: Why Simplicity Is The Path To Trust For Agentic AI
articles.author: Tony Bradley
articles.summary: AWS re:Inforce talked about AI in cybersecurity. The company's vision for agentic AI is about reducing noise, setting firm boundaries and simplifying how organizations experience security. The biggest risk for CISOs may not be over-trusting AI but under-trusted it.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 10:34 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: Study says AI chatbots are inconsistent in handling suicide-related queries. The chatbots generally avoid answering high-risk questions but vary in responses to indirect prompts. The research highlights the need for "further refinement" in these tools and raises concerns about people relying on AI for mental health support.

articles.title: Nvidia's new $3,500 AI ‘brain' is poised to supercharge automation—and could give rise to what Jensen Huang calls the final phase of AI
articles.author: Dave Smith
articles.summary: Jetson Thor is a compact computer designed to sit inside a robot and run multiple AI models at once. It costs $3,499 and starts shipping next month. It's powered by the company's top-end Blackwell chips. Jetson Thor provides up to 7.5x higher AI compute and 3.5X better energy efficiency.

articles.title: Nvidia's new $3,500 ‘brain' could herald what Jensen Huang calls the final phase of AI
articles.author: Dave Smith
articles.summary: Jetson Thor is a compact computer designed to sit inside a robot and run multiple AI models at once. It's powered by the company's top-end Blackwell chips, which are sought-after by most countries trying to build AI at scale. Jetson Thor's combination of on-board power and software lets a robot handle many senses and skills simultaneously.

articles.title: Letter to the editor: Do we really need this much AI?
articles.author: The Washington Times Https
articles.summary: There are real problems associated with maintaining massive AI data centers. Cooling the circuitry needed to create AI requires millions of gallons of water annually. Some AI providers are planning to build nuclear plants nearby. China has begun building massive underwater data centers off Shanghai using seawater and offshore wind to cut cooling costs and energy use.

articles.title: Qualified Unveils The World's First AI SDR Superagent
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Piper is the world's first full-funnel AI SDR superagent that can engage, nurture, and convert buyers through multi-modal, face-to-face experiences at every stage of the marketing funnel. Qualified has brought over 500 companies onto the platform.

articles.title: Manufacturing firms are using AI to fill labor shortages - but this human skill still matters
articles.summary: Manufacturers in America's industrial belt are facing a shortage of skilled workers. They are turning to artificial intelligence to fill the gap.    ZDNet highlights how firms are deploying AI not just for automation but to actively fill roles that need to be filled.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 10:27 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: Study says AI chatbots are inconsistent in handling suicide-related queries. The chatbots generally avoid answering high-risk questions but vary in responses to indirect prompts. The research highlights the need for "further refinement" in these tools and raises concerns about people relying on AI for mental health support.

articles.title: Chatbots make it easier to get career advice from AI. Here's how workers really feel about it
articles.author: Jennifer Liu
articles.summary: People are turning to AI chatbots for career advice. Priscilla Abii, 25, is a marketing assistant near Baltimore. Jeanie Thompson, 23, uses Fide, an invite-only career app, to help her prepare for a job interview or get started in a certain field.

articles.title: Melania Trump announces nationwide Presidential AI Challenge
articles.author: Judy Kurtz
articles.summary: Melania Trump is encouraging students to take part in the first-of-its-kind artificial intelligence (AI) competition. The nationwide competition is open to students in kindergarten through 12th grade. It's aimed at bringing young people and educators together 'to solve real-world problems in their communities using AI-powered solutions'

articles.title: How AI Agents Are Affecting The Marketing Industry In 2025
articles.author: Antonio Cao
articles.summary: Antonio Cao is the Co-Founder and CTO of Flair.ai, an AI-powered design platform for e-commerce content. The market for ready-to-deploy AI agents is projected to reach $5.6 billion by 2026. AI adoption has surged, with weekly generative AI use among marketers jumping from 37% in 2023 to 72% by 2024.

articles.title: Melania Trump invites students to participate in AI contest
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Melania Trump invites students in grades K-12 to participate in a government-sponsored nationwide contest using artificial intelligence. The first lady created an AI-powered audio book and championed online safety through the Take It Down Act. The contest was called for in an executive order signed by President Donald Trump on advancing artificial intelligence education for American youth.

articles.title: Melania Trump invites K-12 students to participate in AI challenge contest
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Melania Trump invites students in grades K-12 to participate in a government-sponsored nationwide contest using artificial intelligence. The first lady created an AI-powered audio book and championed online safety through the Take It Down Act. The contest was called for in an executive order signed by President Donald Trump on advancing artificial intelligence education for American youth.

articles.title: Melania Trump invites K-12 students to participate in nationwide AI challenge contest
articles.summary: Every student from kindergarten through 12th grade is invited to complete a project using an artificial intelligence method or tool to address a community challenge. An adult mentor or teacher must sponsor a team. Submissions are due by the end of December. Regional competitions will be held in the spring, followed by a White House event with the national winners.

articles.title: Gemini Image Editing: New Tools & Creative Control
